attributes.action: Delay the date of the EU Referendum to allow as many people to vote as possible
attributes.background: The attempt to extend the franchise for the EU Referendum to 16 year-olds was unsuccessful, meaning thousands of young people and future voters will be denied a voice in this constitutionally significant referendum. By delaying the referendum, as many young people as possible will be able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister himself has admitted that the likes of referendums like these only come around once every generation. It is the younger generations who will have to live with the outcome of this referendum for the majority of their lives, potentially all of it. I will turn 18 just 4 months after the referendum is rumoured to take place: denied a voice for the sake of 4 months. If the referendum were to be delayed until 2017, thousands more young people will have a say in their own future.

attributes.action: Stop legally classifying pets as property.
attributes.background: Pets are not property. They are loving companions, family members, they can perform important tasks. The theft, abuse, murder of pets causes deep psycological and emotional distress and crimes against people's pets must be taken extremely seriously in court and perpetrators severely punished.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Call for the DVLA to standardise gender identification on UK licences
attributes.background: Join us to campaign for gender equality. While licences for men start with their first name, all women have their first name prefixed with a marital status title such as 'Miss' / 'Mrs'. These options are selected at application stage, but whereby men selecting 'Mr' do not have this appear, women do.
attributes.additional_details: As a British National, only two forms of photo ID are recongnised; your passport and driver's licence. You driving licence is designed to be credit card sized, and in robust, thick plastic to be carried on your person at all times (unlike a paper passport). I love our country believe that in 2016 persons should be allowed to have their main, day-to-day ID display a fair indicator of the gender they identify with, rather than singling out women with a relationship status.

attributes.action: Trident to be removed from Scotland and renewed in England
attributes.background: Trident is not welcome in Scotland and rejected by Scottish MPs, if English MPs vote for the renewal of WMD then it should be done in England and not Scotland where it is heavily opposed.

attributes.action: Change all current motorcycle licensing laws.
attributes.background: The current Motorcycle licensing laws are dangerous for young riders and deter them from progressing to a higher licence. The 28MPH limit on 50cc's is extremely dangerous especially on duel carriageways. The A1 licence should be 250/300cc for motorway use, 125cc's are treacherous for motorway use.
attributes.additional_details:
Things that need to change:
1-	Remove the 28MPH limit on 50cc scooters, they are very dangerous. Most people de-restrict them anyway.
2-	Change the following classes 125cc Lerner rider; 250/300cc A1 rider; 600+cc A unrestricted rider
3-	Allow A1 upgrade system after 2 years of holding the A1 license.
4-	Change CBT to include some theory
5-	Lower the cost of tests as failing is up to £75 down the drain
6-	Make more test times available for around 5PM to 7PM Mon to fri and weekends if possible.

attributes.action: Impose a tuition fee cap for international students
attributes.background: The fees for Home/EU students are controlled by the UK Government; however, there isn't a cap for the international students. Institutions may charge international students up to 3 times the Home/EU fees. In addition, institutions may continue to raise the tuition fees. This should be capped.

attributes.action: Local Council Register all fitness professionals that can practice legitimately
attributes.background: Currently there is no regulation of non qualified fitness professionals from practising without qualifications and insurance. To maintain standards a register of all trading fitness/massage persons working/earning should be controlled by local councils. REPS and CIMSPA can only regulate upon members
attributes.additional_details: Poor quality and lack of knowledge isn't the way forward to providing good exercise prescription. This just simply isn't safe if you are charging the client or giving it for free. If you have no qualifications/experience you can mislead people into thinking you can training healthy people or people with diagnosed medical conditions or injuries or even have no insurance. We must raise the standard of what clients have as a fitness professional and impose some kind of penalty.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of Economics at GCSE level.
attributes.background: Teaching Politics does not help voters make an informed decision on matters such as the EU Referendum, as it is largely an economical matter. It gives us little insight to the implications of our decisions. Economics gives children factual knowledge to allow them to form decisions on such matters.
attributes.additional_details:
The effect a decision will have on the economy is central to any debate or issue. To make an informed decision, people require knowledge (e.g how free markets work) and the effect their vote will have on the economy. Knowledge of Economics allows students to make educated and substantial choices.

By teaching Economics, this is providing students skills for adult life, a major issue with schools as they fail to teach students skills useful in adult life such as budgeting, taxes and employment.

attributes.action: Add a capture code to the government petition site to prevent false signatures.
attributes.background: It is now common knowledge that the petition calling for a second referendum has been compromised. A hacker group is using a computerised bot to generate signatures. This petition should now be made null and void and all future petitions should have a captcha code, proving the signature is real
attributes.additional_details: There should also be a way of cross referencing the post code used, with the electoral register, to prevent miscreants from passing their post code for use to all and sundry.

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.

attributes.action: Teach children in schools about voting and parliament - primary school onwards.
attributes.background: After the recent referendum and outcomes of general elections I feel there's a clear need for people to be taught about the process, as well as learning to cross reference and rattify information to ensure they're making a truly informed decision.

attributes.action: Don't rush Brexit: invoke Article 50 after the next general election in 2020.
attributes.background:
The government carried out it's promise to have a referendum; it was not elected to exit the European Union. 

Exiting the European Union is a massive undertaking, and requires planning, strong leadership and clear vision.

For the Brexit to succeed, we need a government elected for the purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Points to consider from the Conservative Manifesto:
"Our commitment to you:
keep our economy secure by running a surplus so that we start paying down our debts."
"We will use our membership of ...the
EU [amongst other organisations]...to achieve the best for Britain."
"We want an EU that helps Britain move ahead..."
"The Conservative Party is the party of the Union
– and we will always do our utmost to keep our family
of nations together."

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: Reject any Brexit terms that exclude the UK from the Common Market
attributes.background: This petition requires that before invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, HM Government must ensure that, following Brexit, British citizens and firms will continue to have full, unprejudiced access to the European Economic Area.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to display a halal food sign in businesses serving halal food.
attributes.background: All businesses serving halal food should clearly display a sign at the entrance of their establishment stating that the food they serve is halal. This would allow people of the Muslim faith to clearly identify where they are permitted to eat and Sikhs to identify where they cannot eat.

attributes.action: The World Heritage City of Bath Should Remain within the EU and leave the UK
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU after 43 years. A 57.9% majority of Bath residents voted to remain. There was a turnout of 105,298 in Bath & NE Somerset, that's 77.13%. 60,878 of residents voted to remain. We are a World Heritage City. We want to remain and share that heritage with Europe.

attributes.action: UK Cities who voted "Remain" to be granted freedom to leave the UK & join the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum should never have happened.  The UK is a REPRESENTATIVE democracy ie we select and pay politicians to do the business of Government for us.  A decision so momentous should not have been handed to an electorate unqualified to comprehend the magnitude of the task.
attributes.additional_details:
The Referendum was about economics & trade. The media & certain politicians made it about blaming hard-working immigrants.

The EU Referendum was not supported by the educated or the young.  It was not supported by the cities.

London has a bigger GDP than many states. My city, Norwich, has thriving links with Europe as does Cambridge.  

We in the cities who voted to Remain in the EU see no alternative but to petition to be allowed to leave a country determined to commit economic suicide.

attributes.action: Impose a cap on tuition fees at £9000 for EU students until 2020.
attributes.background: Due to the result of the recent EU referendum, many EU students who want to study in Britain in coming years now face prices of up to £20,000 as they will be deemed as international students.  To make it fair for these students, we are proposing capping tuition fees until 2020.

attributes.action: Make cycling on a footway an arrestable offence and raise the fine to £1,000.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence in England and Wales to cycle on footways such as pavements, walkways and foot bridges. The current penalty for this is a measly £50 fine despite the danger to pedestrians.  Cycling on footways should be arrestable, the fine increased to £1,000 and cycles seized until paid.
attributes.additional_details:
With the popularity of cycling in the UK on the up, the numbers of people regularly committing offences such as cycling on the pavement is also increasing. Research has shown that cyclists now represent almost as much danger to pedestrians as motorists do, that the injuries inflicted can be as damaging and nearly 100 people in the UK are killed by cyclists each year.

Making this offence arrestable and increasing the fine will act as a better deterrent and improve pedestrian safety.

attributes.action: One copy of the British Bill of Rights for every household.
attributes.background: In anticipation of the UK government's desire to replace the Human Rights act with a British Bill of Rights, it seems vital that every citizen have available to them a hard copy version of the new document thus insuring they can know, with complete transparency, exactly what their rights are.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a long history of enshrining the rights of it's citizens in law, from the Magna Carta in 1215 onwards we actually have a proud history of attempting (if not always succeeding) to insure human rights are protected in law.

In the interests of empowering the people that they should know their rights, and thus aid the government in insuring the public trust it's promise to uphold human rights, giving (not selling) every household a copy of the new document is essential.

attributes.action: Don't ban menthol cigarettes
attributes.background:
Plain packaging is coming into force and there is a proposal to ban menthol cigarettes. 


Menthol cigarettes makes up a large percentage of smokers and has existed for almost a hundred years.


Ban other flavours but make an exception for menthols like the US.
attributes.additional_details:
I thought all cigarettes were the same, so why treat some cigarettes different to others?


- Ban flavours, keep the menthol


- Halt any new anti-tobbaco law for at least 10 years 


- Don't allow cigarette prices to reach £15 by 2020

attributes.action: Veto Turkey's entry into the EU.
attributes.background: Recep Erdoğan's Turkey is a nation of deteriorating rights and authoritarian state harassment. Its GDP is half the EU average. It borders two war-zones. It uses the migrant crisis as blackmail and aggressively seeks prosecution for defamation outside of its borders. NO to Turkey's EU membership.
attributes.additional_details:
FREEDOM HOUSE: https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2016/turkey

AMNESTY: https://www.amnesty.org/en/countries/europe-and-central-asia/turkey/

HUMAN RIGHTS WATCH: https://www.hrw.org/europe/central-asia/turkey

attributes.action: Reconsider the National Insurance banding for public sector employees.
attributes.background: In april 2016 the goverment implemented a rise in the national insurance banding affecting public sector workers including the armed forces, dentists and nurses where the banding has gone from a band D to a band A increasing 1.4% increase NI contributions equating to more than the 1 % payrise given
attributes.additional_details:
The decision for the increase was made in the 2013 budget. Since then the general rate of inflation has already increased

The impact of this rise was felt in receipt  of pay recieved for april where we recieved less than march because of this increase. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pay-awards-for-over-a-million-public-sector-workers

https://www.unison.org.uk/news/press-release/2015/11/unison-says-national-insurance-increase-will-rob-public-sector-workers/

attributes.action: More funding into Camhs and mental health in the uk
attributes.background: So many young people and adults do not get the care that they need for mental health. Young teens have to be inpatients miles away from there family. This is not fair on the families . There is not enough beds for adults. This is not fair on services . Camhs does not have the funding to help .

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn Bridge tolls.
attributes.background: The government recently announced a cut to the Severn Bridge tolls after the bridges revert to public ownership in 2017.  This is not enough. This tax on trade and the local community should be removed particularly in light of the struggling economies of South Wales and the Forest of Dean.

attributes.action: Re-introduce so called 'carry back' of pension contributions (one tax-year only)
attributes.background: The ability for individuals to make a pension contribution and 'carry back' the contribution for one tax-year, will make it easier for individuals to avoid making excess pension contributions and suffering avoidable tax charges, under the new Tapered Annual Allowance. It will reduce HMRC costs too.
attributes.additional_details: Individuals potentially affected by the new Tapered Allowance will find it very difficult to judge whether they are affected and, if so, to what extent, until the latter part of the coming 2016-17 tax-year, making it difficult for these individuals and their professional advisers (accountants and financial planners) to decide what level of pension contribute they can make/receive without suffering a personal tax charge, until say March 2017. Re-introducing carry back will alleviate this problem.

attributes.action: Additional Bank Holiday in October
attributes.background:
From the end of August to the end of December, the UK do not have any bank holidays.
The UK have one of the least amount of Bank Holidays in the world.
I propose an additional Bank Holiday for the UK in between August and December.
attributes.additional_details:
Trafalgar is a popular choice and that was on the 21 October 1805. Nelson died but Britain prevailed. Trafalgar Day has a nice ring.

The Battle of Hastings was fought on the October 14 1066 so could also be around this day

attributes.action: Stop Granting Migrants Citizenship and Help Our Own First!
attributes.background:
1)Migrants that want to be British Citizens should need to have either a high intelligence or trade our country needs. 
2)Migrants to be required to provide evidence of enough money to survive for 2 years and a job prepared. 
3)They shouldn't be allowed to claim ANY benefits for the first 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Britain used to be a strong and powerful country, but this is no longer the case. British citizens believe we should help our people before we offer help to Migrants . We feel let down due to: 1) lack of housing, 2) lack of jobs, 3) cuts to medical care, 4) education spending cuts, 5) cuts to policing, 6) cuts to military, 7) increase in tax cost for the working class 8) lack of humane care for the elderly. We feel this wouldn't be the case if the Government had put US first and not Migrants!

attributes.action: Independent public enquiry to investigate the decision to cut ESA by DWP.
attributes.background: I believe that MP's were mislead prior to voting in favour of cuts to ESA. I believe that the Minister in charge of DWP at the time, told MP's in his own party that the cuts would only apply to individuals who could work. This is not true as if fit for work they would apply for JSA.

attributes.action: Re-introduce Capital Punishment for Terrorism
attributes.background: Since the attack on America on 9/11 2002 when some 3,000 innocent people were murdered there have been at least another 2,000 men, women and children cowardly murdered in addition to those murdered in Belgium today.
attributes.additional_details:
Enough is enough!

Tomorrow it could be you or I or your children or loved ones.

These cowards think that we are weak because we do nothing and whilst ever they believe this they will carry on slaughtering us.

By doing nothing we are in danger of losing the Freedom bought for us at such great cost twice in the last Century.  We must not betray the Sacrifice of those brave men and women who gave their lives for us to live in Freedom.

Those who bring, or would bring, death and destruction into our Homelands should also forfeit their lives in order to save innocent lives and we therefore humbly petition our Members of Parliament to re-introduce the death penalty for anyone found guilty of terrorist offences

attributes.action: End early release for 'good prisoners'. Expect, don't reward proper behaviour.
attributes.background: Currently it is not unusual for prisoners to serve half their sentence due to good behaviour. Such behaviour should be expected as a given in custody, not rewarded by time off. The sentence given should be served in full, and extended if the prisoner does not behave well whilst in custody.

attributes.action: Cap car insurance at a max of £700 for young/first drivers for cars upto 130bhp.
attributes.background: For many young drivers (who are mainly students) cannot afford silly prices insurance companies ask for. We do not deserve to pay thousands after being profiled. A max price should of £700 be set on cars upto 130bhp in order to prove to insurers that not all young drivers deserve to pay thousands.
attributes.additional_details: I myself a long with many others have been given quotes on e.g 1.0 cars upto £10,000! Even paying £2000 is alot in any case and I know people who have been paying that much with telemetry boxes fitted also. A Base price should be set.

attributes.action: Cut the International Aid Budget by 0.2% and use savings to  support UK Welfare.
attributes.background: The International Aid Budget is, in many cases, mis-spent. For instance supporting a strong economy such as India, & many others. We need to act to support UK Citizens in need of welfare support. This small reduction in the IAB will go a long way to meet the need to care for those in the UK.

attributes.action: We need more military personnel at least 500K to give use the security we need.
attributes.background: The UK has a strong but small army, we achieve many goals like defeating terrorist groups but with an army the size of just under 200,000 its hard to achieve all our goals. The recent issues of immigrants coming into the country just proves how much our border's are not protected completely.
attributes.additional_details:
This link shows our armed forces amount in the RAF, NAVY and ARMY, take a look you might be surprised.

http://www.globalfirepower.com/country-military-strength-detail.asp?country_id=united-kingdom

Many smaller countries have armies much bigger then ours and that says something. All the hard work of the British empire has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Disclose any impact assessment for a Post Referendum exit strategy.
attributes.background:
Following The Prime Minister announcing the Referendum on UK membership of the political European Union the Government must have an impact assessment for either result. 

There has to be an exit strategy developed. The public need that information to make an informed decision on their vote.
attributes.additional_details: The Government have compromised the erstwhile impartial Civil Service and made them partial on this issue. It is time for the fair minded public to tell the Government their displeasure at this development.

attributes.action: Stop using the unfair Carr-Hill formula to fund GP practices in England
attributes.background: GP funding is being changed using the fundamentally flawed Carr-Hill formula that does not take into account the diverse needs of different practices. It has also not been released in full so there is no accountability or transparency for the public.
attributes.additional_details: We petition the release of the Carr-Hill formula in full.Following the release of the formula we petition parliament to halt any changes to the way GP's are funded until a full public consultation within each NHS trust is carried out of the Carr-Hill formula as well as a risk assessment for GP practices to ensure the safety of patients in primary care.

attributes.action: Enable children from age 11 to be able to vote in the upcoming EU referendum.
attributes.background: This issue needs immediate action because the upcoming EU referendum will affect the children of the United Kingdom and their future. Surely we have a responsibility to ensure our children have a say for their future.

attributes.action: To provide adequate support and care for people with Multiple Sclerosis
attributes.background: To provide enough nurses and resources to support and care for people with Multiple Sclerosis.

attributes.action: Make Google and other big businesses pay the proper rate of tax
attributes.background:
George Osborne has just negotiated a reported 3% tax rate for Google. Amounting to a £130 million tax bill for a company which made £6 billion in profits in the UK between 2005 and 2015.

In this age of austerity, we need individuals and big business to pull their weight.
attributes.additional_details:
This isn't the first time. While the government may defend their position, claiming to have made measures reducing tax avoidance, these companies agreed to a rate of tax when they began trading here, and should pay it.

While small to medium sizes business pay their fair share, and the self employed are penalised with fines should they fail to pay, big business such as Amazon, Google, Starbucks and numerous others get away with paying a greatly reduced sum.

attributes.action: Additional Law for Police to seize stationary Uninsured/Unregistered vehicles
attributes.background: Currently Police don't have the power to seize vehicles that are parked unattended and uninsured on our roads under S.165 Road Traffic Act 1988 if its taxed etc. A huge problem is criminals buying these cars, not being the registered owner therefore evading possible penalties incurred.
attributes.additional_details:
A REGISTERED vehicle which has INSURANCE will be traceable when it comes to NtO (Fines) etc... 
But if Un-registered / Un-Insured = No parking fines, No speeding fines EVER and driver/owner untraceable to authorities unless they are caught in the act with the vehicle. I petition to enforce a power for police to seize any vehicle on a public road that is not lawfully insured regardless if the owner has been caught driving it or not.
We must be Proactive and not Reactive in crime prevention!

attributes.action: Stop the use of the honours system being used for political gain
attributes.background: All honours to be authorised only via an independent political free board. All members of the board must be free of any political party and any person who has held political office or served in a government department to be barred from holding office on this board
attributes.additional_details: Any person is permitted to put a person forward for any honour . In doing so they must state why they believe such person deserves this award.

attributes.action: Include "Dog on Dog" Attacks in the Dangerous Dog Acts 1991
attributes.background:
Due to my own dog being injured in an unprovoked attack from another dog, I would like to have "dog on dog" attacks include in the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991. 
Any dog that is injured or harmed in an unprovoked attack from another dog should be a criminal offence due to irresponsible ownership.
attributes.additional_details:
Photographic evidence from the attack is available, a report from the veterinary clinic can be requested, and witness statements. 
The incident was reported to the police and has been logged. 
This attack was clearly vicious and distressing to ourselves and the dog, and was completely unprovoked. 
As responsible pet owners, our dog was on a lead and wearing a muzzle, unable to defend himself in the attack.

attributes.action: Early diagnosis for children with autism. Help afterwards.
attributes.background: 'Postcode' lottery for early diagnosis. No help once a diagnosis is made depending where you live.

attributes.action: Working families choice of 30hr funding at age 3 or 15hrs at 3 and 15 at 2
attributes.background: To give working families the choice of whether they want the 30hrs chilcare funding from the age of 3 in 2017 or if they want to split it so they get 15hrs from the age of 2 and 15hrs from the age of 3 has this would benefit alot of families more then the 30hrs from the age of 3.

attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: Form a National Unity negotiation team to immediately start negotiating with EU.
attributes.background: Post EU vote there is a vacuum and high uncertainty. We want to rapidly see the roadmap to clarity and then stability. The terms of our exit from the EU will last well beyond the term of this government. Therefore, a negotiating team reflecting many perspectives is required - a National Unity team.
attributes.additional_details: PM has resigned. His replacement's selection will take time. Shadow cabinet is fragmenting reducing the effective opposition. Scotland, N.Ireland and the young are bitter about the result. The break-up of the UK is a possibility. Markets are jittery. Now is the time for National Unity. Form our EU negotiation team quickly start the herculian task ahead. It should be led by Leave reflecting the people's will, but must be inclusive to reflect those in our society that feel alienated by the vote.

attributes.action: Allow Medicinal Cannabis (Savitex) for all neurological conditions in the UK.
attributes.background: The Welsh NHS have authorised the use of Savitex medicinal cannabis for MS sufferers only in Wales to treat muscle spasticity. However, there are many people in the UK with other neurological conditions such as Cervical Myelopathy and Myelomalacia who also suffer with severe muscle spasms.
attributes.additional_details: There is no magic cure for muscle spasms. There are certain medicines such as Gabapentin, Pregabalin, Baclofen ect but many patients do not benefit from them orally. To treat severe muscle spasms, many patients are offered the insertion of a Baclofen Pump instead. A recent cost analysis by the MS Foundation has found that it is cheaper to prescribe Savitex than insert and regularly maintain a Baclofen pump. Savitex trials have proved positive in reducing muscle spasms. Please support our campaign - it is cost effective. MS sufferers are allowed the drug why can't all people suffering with neurological conditions in the UK have access to it ?
